des:
The Bosch EasyAir skill enables users of the BCC100 and BCC50 users to use their voice to control their thermostat(s).

The Bosch Connected Control is a sleek, Internet-connected thermostat that offers easy all-in-one control for heating and cooling systems. It can be controlled through the Bosch EasyAir app and is compatible with most 24V HVAC equipment on the market.

The Bosch Connected Control can be installed and set up in a few easy steps. Please visit our website and review our User Guide for instructions on how to set up your device: https://www.bosch-thermotechnology.us/us/en/ocs/residential/wi-fi-thermostats-1098978-c/

Once installed and connected to the Bosch EasyAir app, Bosch offers one Smart Home Skill for integrating your thermostat with Amazon Alexa’s voice controls. Using the Bosch Connected Control Skill from the Skills section of the Amazon Alexa App, you can control the thermostat by saying:
1. Alexa, turn (Device Name) off.
2. Alexa, turn (Device Name) on.
3. Alexa, Increase (Device Name) by __ degrees.
4. Alexa, Decrease (Device Name) by __ degrees.
5. Alexa, Set (Device Name) to __ degrees.
6. Alexa, what is the (Device Name) set to.
7. Alexa, what is the temperature of the (Device Name)

*The Device Name is the name assigned to your device in the Bosch EasyAir app. You can check the device name by opening the Bosch EasyAir app and reading the name displayed on the main menu of selectable devices.

** Due to the compatibility requirement, our temperature range in auto mode will be 7°C to 38°C, or 45°F to 99°F.

Follow these simple steps to connect your thermostat to your Alexa-enabled device:

1. Download the EasyAir app, create an account, and register your app to the BCC thermostat.
You must have a registered Bosch EasyAir (SingleKeyId) account to set up and use your thermostat with Amazon Alexa.

2. Download the Amazon Alexa app and set up your Alexa-enabled device.

3. In the Amazon Alexa app, click on the menu button in the top left corner.

4. Click on the Skills section and search for “Bosch EasyAir” in the search bar at the top of the page.

5. Once found, click on the Bosch Connected Control skill and click on the blue Enable button.

6. The setup process redirects you to a Bosch sign-in page (SingleKeyId) where you will need to enter the same account username and password that you used with the Bosch EasyAir App.

7. After you have received confirmation that your accounts have been successfully linked, click Done in the top left-hand corner.

8. Next, click Discover Devices in the Amazon Alexa app or say “Alexa, discover new devices.” Device Discovery could take up to 20 seconds.

9. When device discovery is complete, you should see a list of connected devices in the Smart Home menu of your Amazon Alexa app.

The setup process should now be complete and you can start to control your BCC with your Alexa enabled device. Try out some of the commands above and enjoy!
